AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Raul Rafael Arce-Jasso: defendant, appellant, and defendant-appellee in a case involving possession of cocaine with intent to distribute, driver of the Mercury Cougar, pleaded not guilty before a magistrate judge, filed motions for reconsideration and judgment of acquittal, contends that appeals from judgments of acquittal are not permitted, made a motion for judgment of acquittal, had counsel preserve issue of legality of immigration stop for appeal, argues against Government's right to appeal from judgments of acquittal, argues that the law of the case doctrine precludes the Government from presenting an adequate case, defendant whose judgment of acquittal was appealed by the Government, owner of a vehicle suspected of being used for smuggling
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.Jesus Garcia: border patrol agent manning the primary inspection lane at the border patrol checkpoint, questioned Arce-Jasso about his citizenship, stated questions about common destinations for illegal aliens
AUXILIARY_DESCRIPTIONS.United States of America: plaintiff-appellant seeking review of the district court's judgment of acquittal and denial of motion for reconsideration, filed joint notice of appeal, has the ability to appeal suppression of evidence in criminal cases under certain conditions, concedes failure to meet 30-day deadline if clock started on August 12
